refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkProgressBar is typically used to display the progress of a long running operation. It provides a visual clue that processing is underway. The GtkProgressBar can be used in two different modes: percentage mode and activity mode.

When an application can determine how much work needs to take place (e.g. read a fixed number of bytes from a file) and can monitor its progress, it can use the GtkProgressBar in percentage mode and the user sees a growing bar indicating the percentage of the work that has been completed. In this mode, the application is required to call gtk_progress_bar_set_fraction() periodically to update the progress bar.

When an application has no accurate way of knowing the amount of work to do, it can use the GtkProgressBar in activity mode, which shows activity by a block moving back and forth within the progress area. In this mode, the application is required to call gtk_progress_bar_pulse() perodically to update the progress bar.

There is quite a bit of flexibility provided to control the appearance of the GtkProgressBar. Functions are provided to control the orientation of the bar, optional text can be displayed along with the bar, and the step size used in activity mode can be set.

note.para: The GtkProgressBar/GtkProgress API in GTK 1.2 was bloated, needlessly complex and hard to use properly. Therefore GtkProgress has been deprecated completely and the GtkProgressBar API has been reduced to the following 10 functions: gtk_progress_bar_new(), gtk_progress_bar_pulse(), gtk_progress_bar_set_text(), gtk_progress_bar_set_fraction(), gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step(), gtk_progress_bar_set_orientation(), gtk_progress_bar_get_text(), gtk_progress_bar_get_fraction(), gtk_progress_bar_get_pulse_step(), gtk_progress_bar_get_orientation(). These have been grouped at the beginning of this section, followed by a large chunk of deprecated 1.2 compatibility functions.

refsect2.title: struct GtkProgressBar
refsect2.para: The GtkProgressBar-struct struct contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_pulse ()
refsect2.para: Indicates that some progress is made, but you don't know how much. Causes the progress bar to enter "activity mode," where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step()).

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_text ()
refsect2.para: Causes the given text to appear superimposed on the progress bar.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_fraction ()
refsect2.para: Causes the progress bar to "fill in" the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

listitem.simpara: fraction of the task that's been completed

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step ()
refsect2.para: Sets the fraction of total progress bar length to move the bouncing block for each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse().

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_orientation ()
refsect2.para: Causes the progress bar to switch to a different orientation (left-to-right, right-to-left, top-to-bottom, or bottom-to-top).

refsect2.title: enum GtkProgressBarOrientation
refsect2.para: An enumeration representing possible orientations and growth directions for the visible progress bar.

listitem.simpara: A horizontal progress bar growing from left to right.
A horizontal progress bar growing from right to left.
A vertical progress bar growing from bottom to top.
A vertical progress bar growing from top to bottom.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_get_text ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the text displayed superimposed on the progress bar, if any, otherwise NULL. The return value is a reference to the text, not a copy of it, so will become invalid if you change the text in the progress bar.

listitem.simpara: text, or NULL; this string is owned by the widget and should not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_get_fraction ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current fraction of the task that's been completed.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_get_pulse_step ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step()

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_get_orientation ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the current progress bar orientation.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_new_with_adjustment ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_new_with_adjustment is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkProgressBar with an associated GtkAdjustment.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_bar_style ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_set_bar_style is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the style of the GtkProgressBar. The default style is GTK_PROGRESS_CONTINUOUS.

listitem.simpara: a GtkProgressBarStyle value indicating the desired style.

refsect2.title: enum GtkProgressBarStyle
refsect2.para: An enumeration representing the styles for drawing the progress bar.

listitem.simpara: The progress bar grows in a smooth, continuous manner.
The progress bar grows in discrete, visible blocks.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_discrete_blocks ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_set_discrete_blocks is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the number of blocks that the progress bar is divided into when the style is GTK_PROGRESS_DISCRETE.

listitem.simpara: number of individual blocks making up the bar.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_activity_step ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_set_activity_step is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the step value used when the progress bar is in activity mode. The step is the amount by which the progress is incremented each iteration.

listitem.simpara: the amount which the progress is incremented in activity mode.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_set_activity_blocks ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_set_activity_blocks is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the number of blocks used when the progress bar is in activity mode. Larger numbers make the visible block smaller.

listitem.simpara: number of blocks which can fit within the progress bar area.

refsect2.title: gtk_progress_bar_update ()

warning.para: gtk_progress_bar_update is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: This function is deprecated. Please use gtk_progress_set_value() or gtk_progress_set_percentage() instead.
